complexityChecks.description: When supported by the stack, run cyclomatic complexity or similar metrics in CI as a warning-only check initially.

qualityGatePolicy.description: New quality checks should warn on existing code and fail CI only for violations introduced in new or changed code, to reduce friction on legacy codebases.

migrationGuide.title: Establish Local Safety Nets First
migrationGuide.description: Start by adding pre-commit hooks and core formatting/linting so developers get fast feedback without touching CI.
migrationGuide.notes: Keep hooks fast and focused on changed files to avoid slowing down day-to-day work.

migrationGuide.title: Mirror Local Checks in CI (Soft-Fail on Legacy)
migrationGuide.description: Introduce CI quality gates that mirror local checks, but treat existing violations as warnings wherever possible.
migrationGuide.notes: Use diff-based tools or baselines so only new violations break builds; legacy issues remain visible but non-blocking.

migrationGuide.title: Add Type Safety, Coverage, and Dependency Security
migrationGuide.description: Enable type-checking, coverage thresholds, and dependency/vulnerability scanning with gradual enforcement.
migrationGuide.notes: Pin tool and runtime versions in CI and containers to avoid flaky differences across environments.

migrationGuide.title: Layer in Docs, Governance, and Recommended Checks
migrationGuide.description: Add documentation standards, governance files, integration testing, performance baselines, complexity analysis, accessibility auditing, and (optionally) ML-specific practices for data-heavy Python repos.
migrationGuide.notes: Tackle recommended items in order of business value; backend-only repos can skip web-focused checks like accessibility. For AI/ML-heavy Python teams, consider extending containerization with data versioning (DVC) and unit tests with data quality checks (e.g., Great Expectations) as part of this step.

detectionRules.notes: Detection uses repo-root markers only. Nested BUILD files do not trigger Bazel mode.

optOut.description: Set meta.bazelIntegration.enabled = false in repo config to disable Bazel hints

targetConventions.description: Recommended target naming (not assumed to exist). These are illustrative patterns; actual targets are repo-defined.
targetConventions.lint: //tools/lint:lint or bazel test //... with lint aspects

bazelIntegration.advisoryNotice: bazelHints are suggestions, not required execution paths. Consumers should prefer stack-native commands unless explicitly adopting Bazel.

core.label: Git and Docker Ignore Files
core.description: Maintain proper .gitignore and .dockerignore files to prevent committing secrets, build artifacts, or unnecessary files.

stack.notes: Use the official github/gitignore Go template. Exclude vendor/ (if not vendoring), *.exe, *.test, *.out, and IDE-specific files. .dockerignore must exclude .git and local build output.
stack.verification: .gitignore must exist; .dockerignore is recommended when containerizing or using Docker workflows.

core.label: Linting
core.description: Run static code linting to enforce consistency and catch common issues early.

stack.notes: Use golangci-lint as the primary linter aggregator. Configure enabled linters in .golangci.yml for consistent team-wide enforcement.
stack.verification: .golangci.yml or .golangci.yaml indicates linting is configured. Run 'golangci-lint run' to verify.

bazelHints.notes: Use nogo for static analysis via rules_go. Configure nogo target with desired analyzers.

core.label: Unit Test Runner
core.description: Provide a deterministic unit test framework with a single command to run all tests.

stack.notes: Use 'go test ./...' to run all tests. Place test files alongside source files with _test.go suffix. Keep unit tests fast and isolated.
stack.verification: Run 'go test ./...' to verify the test suite is configured and passing.

bazelHints.notes: rules_go go_test targets wrap 'go test' with Bazel's caching and hermeticity.

core.label: Containerization (Docker / Docker Compose)
core.description: Provide a Dockerfile and, if applicable, a docker-compose file for local dev and CI parity.

stack.notes: Use multi-stage builds: builder stage with golang:alpine, then copy binary to scratch or distroless for minimal runtime. Set CGO_ENABLED=0 for static binaries.
stack.verification: Dockerfile must be present; docker-compose.yml is optional and indicates orchestration usage.

core.label: Semantic Versioning
core.description: Use MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH versioning with clear rules and automated changelog generation based on commit history.

stack.notes: Go uses git tags for versioning (v1.2.3 format). Use goreleaser for automated releases with changelog generation. Tag versions consistently.
stack.verification: Check that git tags follow vMAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format and goreleaser or similar tool generates releases and changelogs.

core.label: Commit Linting
core.description: Enforce structured commit messages such as Conventional Commits.

stack.notes: Use commitlint with pre-commit hooks for enforcing Conventional Commits. Consistent with goreleaser changelog generation.
stack.verification: Test that non-conforming commit messages are rejected by the configured hooks or CI check.

core.label: Unit Test Reporter / Coverage
core.description: Generate readable unit test and coverage reports and enforce a minimum coverage threshold (around 80%) for new or changed code.

stack.notes: Use 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./...' for coverage. Generate HTML or integrate with codecov/coveralls.
stack.verification: Run 'go test -cover ./...' and verify coverage reports are produced and thresholds monitored.

bazelHints.notes: rules_go supports coverage via bazel coverage. Use --combined_report=lcov for aggregated output.

core.label: CI Quality Gates
core.description: Single CI pipeline that runs linting, formatting, type checking, tests, coverage, build, and containerization.

stack.notes: Run 'golangci-lint run', 'go test ./...', 'go build' as quality gates. Use govulncheck for security scanning.
stack.verification: Verify CI runs golangci-lint, go test, and go build before merging to main.

bazelHints.notes: rules_go go_binary and go_test targets provide hermetic builds and tests.

core.label: Code Formatter
core.description: Automatic code formatting to maintain a consistent style across all contributors.

stack.notes: Use gofmt (built-in) for formatting. goimports extends gofmt with import organization. Formatting is enforced by convention.
stack.verification: Run 'gofmt -d .' or 'goimports -d .' and confirm no output indicates clean formatting.

bazelHints.notes: Run gofmt via the Bazel-managed Go SDK for hermetic formatting checks.

core.label: Pre-Commit Hooks
core.description: Use git hooks to run linting, formatting, tests, and commit linting before changes are committed.

stack.notes: Use pre-commit with go hooks for gofmt, goimports, and golangci-lint on staged files.
stack.verification: Inspect hooks configuration and confirm that go fmt and golangci-lint run before commits.

core.label: Type Checking
core.description: Use static type checking to catch errors before runtime and enforce strictness on new code.

stack.notes: Go has compile-time type checking built in. Use 'go vet' for additional static analysis. staticcheck provides enhanced type-related checks.
stack.verification: Run 'go build ./...' to verify type correctness. Use 'go vet ./...' for additional static analysis.

bazelHints.notes: Go type checking is inherent to compilation. bazel build with rules_go enforces type safety.

core.label: Dependency Management & Vulnerability Scanning
core.description: Lock dependencies and scan regularly for known vulnerabilities; fail CI on newly introduced high-severity issues.

stack.notes: Use govulncheck (official Go tool) for vulnerability scanning. go.sum locks dependency checksums for reproducible builds.
stack.verification: go.sum is present; run 'govulncheck ./...' to verify security scanning.

core.label: Runtime Version Specification
core.description: Specify required runtime/engine versions in package manifests to ensure environment stability and prevent version-related issues across development teams.

stack.notes: Specify 'go' directive in go.mod (e.g., go 1.21) to set minimum Go version. Consider .go-version for goenv users.
stack.verification: go.mod must contain 'go' directive specifying minimum version; .go-version is optional for local development.

core.label: Documentation Standards
core.description: Maintain a comprehensive README and, where applicable, auto-generated API docs to support onboarding and maintainability.

stack.notes: Use godoc or pkgsite for API documentation from code comments. Follow Go documentation conventions.
stack.verification: README.md is present; documentation comments exist in exported functions/types.

core.label: Repository Governance
core.description: Include standard governance files (LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md), branch protection rules, and review standards to define legal, ethical, and workflow expectations.

stack.notes: Include license identifier in go.mod comments if needed. Document Go module conventions and testing requirements in CONTRIBUTING.md.
stack.verification: LICENSE file is present; CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md and CONTRIBUTING.md provide contribution guidance.

recommended.label: Dependency Update Automation
recommended.description: Automate dependency updates using Renovate or Dependabot to keep dependencies current and reduce security exposure window.

azure-devops.notes: CI hints are suggested mappings; adjust to your pipeline topology.

github-actions.notes: CI hints are suggested mappings; adjust to your workflow structure.

stack.notes: Both support go.mod/go.sum. Renovate handles replace directives better. Security scanning is covered by dependency-security (govulncheck).
stack.verification: Check for renovate.json OR .github/dependabot.yml. Verify Go module PRs.

recommended.label: Dependency Architecture Rules
recommended.description: Enforce module boundaries and import constraints to prevent architectural drift and unwanted coupling.

azure-devops.notes: CI hints are suggested mappings; adjust to your pipeline topology.

github-actions.notes: CI hints are suggested mappings; adjust to your workflow structure.

stack.notes: Go's module system is simpler. Use internal/ packages for visibility. depaware provides transitive dep analysis. Standard practice: 'go mod tidy && git diff --exit-code go.mod go.sum'.
stack.verification: Run 'go mod verify' and 'go mod tidy' with diff check in CI.

recommended.label: Integration Testing
recommended.description: Test how components interact with each other and external systems, running after unit tests with more relaxed coverage thresholds.

stack.notes: Use build tags (//go:build integration) or separate test directories for integration tests. Run with 'go test -tags=integration ./...'.
stack.verification: Confirm integration tests exist and run 'go test -tags=integration ./...' to verify.

recommended.label: Performance Baselines
recommended.description: Establish performance baselines and monitor for regressions using lightweight benchmarks or audits in CI.

stack.notes: Use 'go test -bench=. ./...' for benchmarks. Use benchstat to compare results across runs.
stack.verification: Run 'go test -bench=. ./...' and verify benchmark results are tracked over time.

recommended.label: Complexity Analysis
recommended.description: Measure cyclomatic complexity or similar metrics to keep code maintainable, starting as a warning-only check.

stack.notes: Use gocyclo or golangci-lint's gocyclo linter to measure cyclomatic complexity. Configure threshold in .golangci.yml.
stack.verification: Run 'gocyclo' or 'golangci-lint run' and review complexity reports, ensuring new code doesn't exceed thresholds.

recommended.label: Accessibility Auditing
recommended.description: Run accessibility checks on web-facing components to detect critical issues and improve inclusive UX.

stack.notes: For Go web apps, use headless browser-based accessibility tools to audit rendered HTML from templates.
stack.verification: For web-facing Go apps, run accessibility audits against key routes using axe or pa11y.

optionalEnhancements.label: Observability (Logging & Error Handling)
optionalEnhancements.description: Standardize error handling and structured logging to make debugging and production monitoring easier.

stack.notes: Use slog (stdlib) or zap/zerolog for structured logging. Configure JSON output for production and text for development.
stack.verification: Confirm that a structured logging library is configured with appropriate output format and log levels.
